meta.title: What did I learn this week (2021) - 27
meta.description: Weekly summarization and review of things I've learned in the first week of July 2021

pageProps.content:
• Github Copilot - GitHub Copilot is an artificial intelligence tool developed by GitHub and OpenAI to assist users of Visual Studio Code by autocompleting code. GitHub Copilot is powered by Codex, the new AI system created by OpenAI. There was an incident reported in which Copilot taking sweary comments from Quake code.
  • Learned why some fighter jets have two pilots while other have only one.
  • Brave browser launched its own privacy focused search engine. With first usage i find it better than duck, it is still in beta though.
  • Read a very informative article on the workflow and usage of Blender for the 'Rabbid Invasion' animated series.
  • Rome's Colosseum opens its underground for the first time in its history
